titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 127

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

summary.p: 10 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 127; Qurʾānic Text: Q 6:56-6:72; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 108 x 162mm; Script style: kūfī D.Va.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
10 fol. 162×108 mm (1.5). Support: thin transparent parchment, smooth, of yellowish color. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: one complete quire, fol. 1 and 10 (now detached) used to be a bifolium, fol. 3 and 8, 5 and 6 are bifolia, the rest are singletons with stubs.
I: H1F H2F S H3F H4F S H5F / F6H F7H S F8H F9H S F10H.
Text layout: 95/96×60 mm (1.6), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D Va . Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: round red, orange and green dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – small rosettes (type 3.1.2) in gold and colors; for groups of five verses – medallion (type 4.A.II), in gold and colors with the inscribed word خمس (fol. 6v); for groups of ten verses – medallion on the margins (type 3.B.II), in gold and colors, with the inscribed word عشر (fol. 3v, 9v).
The golden inscription (السبع الثاني) under and above the medallion on fol. 3v marks the beginning of the second sub‘ (1/7th part of Qur’ān).
Stitching: threads have been preserved in the punctures of the inner bifolium of the quire; traces of brown substance (leather of the spine?) on the outer fold of the quire.
Inscriptions: numbers of surahs in Roman numerals and the verse numbers in Arabic numerals are inscribed in ink on the upper margin of all pages; numbers of verses are also marked in the text.

Attached materials: old cardboard wrapper inscribed with consisting the old accession number “К”, brief description of the manuscripts in French “7 lignes | 10 feuillets | [...] partie du ch[apitre] VI. | Vu entierement”; number “№ 13” and letter “L” in a different hand (fol. I); accession number “№ 7” inscribed on the verso side of the second half of the wrapper (fol. IIv).
Defects: minor stains; edges of sheets are slightly damaged, probably by rodents.
Old accession numbers: К (on the wrapper); №13; L (on the wrapper); № 7 (according to the 2nd Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–10v. Surah 6, verses 56(56)–71(72). Incipit:[من دون الله] قل لا أتيع أهواءكم . Explicit: أقيموا [الصلاة] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
